introduction.paragraph3: Welcome to Church Translator ("we", "our", "us"). “Church Translator” is an app developed and operated by Futures Church South Australia Incorporated (“Futures Church”). For privacy purposes, Futures Church is responsible for the collection and handling of your data in accordance with this policy.
introduction.paragraph4: Church Translator complies with the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs) under the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) for the collection, use, disclosure, and storage of personal information. We are also committed to fulfilling applicable obligations under Apple and Google Play’s app store privacy requirements, ensuring a safe, transparent experience as you use our services.
introduction.paragraph5: This document outlines our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service ("Terms"). By accessing or using Church Translator, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

information_we_collect.title: 1. Information We Collect
information_we_collect.paragraph1: When you create an account with Church Translator, we collect the following personal information:

list_items.name: Name
list_items.faith_status: Faith status (e.g., no faith, little faith, strong faith, etc.)

information_we_collect.paragraph2: If you use our audio or profile features, we may also request access to your device’s microphone, camera, or photo library. See below for how this information is used.
information_we_collect.paragraph3: We may also collect limited device and usage information (e.g., IP address, app version, crash logs) to improve app functionality.

legal_basis.title: 2. Legal Basis for Data Processing
legal_basis.paragraph1: We process your personal information based on the following legal grounds:

list_items.consent: Consent: We rely on your consent to collect and use optional or sensitive data, such as your faith status, church affiliation, and use of your microphone, camera, or photo library. You can withdraw your consent at any time via your device settings or by contacting us.
list_items.legitimate_interest: Legitimate Interest: We process your information to monitor the impact of the Church Translator app, evaluate engagement with spiritual content, support church leadership in caring for their communities, and fulfill accountability requirements set by our funding partners. We believe this use is proportionate, reasonable, and does not override your rights.
list_items.contract_fulfilment: Contract Fulfilment: Some personal data is processed to allow us to provide our core translation services, manage your account, and fulfill the terms of service you agree to when using the app.

how_we_use.title: 3. How We Use Your Information

list_items.provide_translation: Provide live translation services during events.
list_items.manage_profile: Enable you to manage your personal profile and use app features.
list_items.share_pastors: Share relevant details with authorised pastors or leadership or your registered church to help provide pastoral support.
list_items.monitor_kpis: Monitor overall app usage trends and meet organisational Key Performance indicators (KPIs). This includes (but is not limited to) tracking engagement and salvation decisions to help evaluate spiritual growth.
list_items.improve_functionality: Monitor usage trends to improve app functionality and experience.

how_we_use.paragraph2: We do not collect personal data without your knowledge, and we only use the information for the purposes outlined in this document.
how_we_use.paragraph3: We do not use your data for third-party advertising or sell your personal information.

profile_photos.title: 4. Profile Photos
profile_photos.paragraph1: If you choose to upload a profile photo within Church Translator, we may request access to your device's:
profile_photos.paragraph2: Adding a photo is optional and only used within your personal profile. It is not shared, published or used for marketing purposes. You may revoke this permission at any time via your device settings.

microphone_access.title: 5. Microphone Access
microphone_access.paragraph1: Microphone access is required to provide real-time audio translation directly to your device.

list_items.active_sessions: Access is used only during active translation sessions.
list_items.audio_not_stored: Audio is not recorded, stored, or reused beyond what is necessary for real-time translation.

microphone_access.paragraph2: You may withdraw microphone access at any time via device settings, however translation will not occur while this feature is disabled.

third_party_services.title: 6. Third-Party Services
third_party_services.paragraph1: Church Translator uses the following third-party services strictly for core functionality:

list_items.microsoft_azure: Microsoft Azure – Servers located in Melbourne, Australia, used to host core application services.
list_items.mongodb_atlas: MongoDB Atlas (hosted by Amazon Web Services) – Database services located in Sydney, Australia, used to store and manage user data securely.

third_party_services.paragraph2: These services are essential for delivering features such as real-time translation, speech-to-text, and text-to-speech functionality in response to user-initiated actions.
third_party_services.paragraph3: We do not share your personal information (such as your name, email, mobile number, faith status, or church details) with these service providers for marketing, advertising, or any other secondary purposes. The data processed through these services is limited to what is necessary to fulfil your requests and ensure proper operation of the app. All data handling is performed in accordance with strict security and privacy standards.

international_data_transfer.title: 7. International Data Transfer
international_data_transfer.paragraph1: All personal data collected through the Church Translator app is stored and managed on servers located within Australia (see “Section 6. Third-Party Services” for more details).
international_data_transfer.paragraph2: While we do not store or process data on servers located outside Australia, users accessing the app from overseas may transmit data to our Australian servers. This means that cross-border data transfers may occur when international users interact with the app.
international_data_transfer.paragraph3: We ensure that all such transfers are handled securely, using encrypted transmission protocols (e.g., TLS 1.2+) to protect your information as it is sent to our servers in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

data_access_sharing.title: 8. Data Access and Sharing
data_access_sharing.paragraph1: Your data is accessible only to:

list_items.authorised_leadership: Authorised leadership from your affiliated church.

data_access_sharing.paragraph2: All access to the data governed by strict confidentiality agreements and secured through appropriate technical and organisational measures.

data_security.title: 9. Data Security
data_security.paragraph1: We use industry-standard technical and organisational safeguards, including:

list_items.tls_ssl: TLS 1.2+ and SSL encryption for secure data transmission
list_items.encryption: Data encryption at rest and in transit
list_items.role_based_access: Role-based access control to limit internal data access

data_security.paragraph2: We continually assess and upgrade our security to match best practices; however, we are unable to guarantee absolute protection of data and metrics. Church Translator cannot accept responsibility for the security or information you send to or receive from us over the Internet, or for any unauthorised access or use of that information.

data_retention_deletion.title: 10. Data Retention and Deletion
data_retention_deletion.paragraph1: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary for its intended purpose. You may delete your account by:

list_items.option2_step2: Include your full name and registered email

data_retention_deletion.paragraph2: Your data will be deleted within 30 days unless we are legally required to retain it for a longer period.

data_breach_notification.title: 11. Data Breach Notification
data_breach_notification.paragraph1: In the event of a data breach which is considered likely to result in serious harm, we will notify affected users and the Office of the Australian Information Commissioner (OAIC) in accordance with the Notifiable Data Breaches (NDB)scheme.

list_items.access_correct: Access and correct your personal data
list_items.request_deletion: Request deletion of your account and personal data
list_items.withdraw_consent: Withdraw consent to data collection (e.g., camera, microphone)
list_items.lodge_complaint: Lodge a complaint with the OAIC if you believe your data has been mishandled

childrens_privacy.title: 13. Children's Privacy and Eligibility
childrens_privacy.paragraph1: You must be at least 13 years old to use the app. Users under 18 must have parental or guardian consent.
childrens_privacy.paragraph2: We do not knowingly collect data from children under 13. If we become aware of such data collection, we will prioritise deleting the information from our server.

list_items.accurate_information: Provide accurate and truthful information during sign-up
list_items.lawful_purposes: Use the app only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms

termination.title: 15. Termination
termination.paragraph1: We may suspend or terminate your account if:

list_items.legal_security: Termination is required for legal or security reasons

termination.paragraph2: If we suspend or terminate your account, it will be deleted from our servers.
termination.paragraph3: You may also delete your account at any time by contacting support or using the in-app settings.

intellectual_property.title: 16. Intellectual Property
intellectual_property.paragraph1: Church Translator and its contents are the property of Futures Church. All rights reserved. You may not copy, modify, or distribute any part of the app without written consent.

limitation_liability.title: 17. Limitation of Liability
limitation_liability.paragraph1: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Futures Church, its staff, and app developers are not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from app use.

governing_law.title: 18. Governing Law
governing_law.paragraph1: These Terms are governed by the laws of South Australia, Australia. Disputes will be handled under the jurisdiction of South Australian courts.

changes_policy.title: 19. Changes to This Policy
changes_policy.paragraph1: We may revise these Terms and Privacy Policy from time to time.
changes_policy.paragraph2: We will notify you of significant changes via the app or email, and the amended version will be made available on our website at <blue>lauren.van.niekerk@futures.church</blue> Continued use of Church Translator following notification of such changes will be taken as acceptance of the updated Terms.

disclaimer.title: 20. Disclaimer
disclaimer.paragraph1: Church Translator is provided “as is” and “as available”. We do not guarantee uninterrupted service or completely accurate translations.

contact_us.title: 21. Contact Us
contact_us.paragraph1: If you have any questions, requests, or concerns regarding these Terms or our Privacy Policy, please contact us at:
contact_us.paragraph2: Church Translator is a ministry initiative developed and operated by Futures Church South Australia Incorporated (ABN: 94 916 517 224), an Australian registered charity.

introduction.paragraph1: Futures Church (Assemblies of God Paradise inc) ABN 79 020 003 383 understands that protecting your privacy and confidentiality is fundamental in how we care for people.
introduction.paragraph2: Futures Church (the Church) Like many other organisations must comply with the National Privacy Principles contained in the Australian Privacy Act when dealing with personal information.
introduction.paragraph3: This Privacy Policy covers the Church's treatment of personally identifiable information that we collect or hold.

information_collect.title: 1. The information we collect
information_collect.paragraph1: We collect information to provide better outcomes to all that attend our events, facilities and services.
information_collect.paragraph2: We will only collect personal and sensitive information that is necessary for us to carry out these functions and provide these services and programs. The type of information we may collect, hold and use, varies depending on the purpose for which it is collected but may include (amongst others):

list_items.personal_details: personal details such as your title, name and date of birth
list_items.contact_details: contact details such as postal address, post code, email, mobile and telephone numbers
list_items.demographic_information: when relevant to our mission, demographic information such as marital status, nationality, education, employment/qualifications and family details
list_items.financial_information: financial information such as credit card details, donation history and your bank details
list_items.family_details: spouse and family details when you jointly volunteer, register for events, and/or register your children for any reason at Futures Church
list_items.employee_volunteer_data: employee and volunteer data such as qualifications, languages and experience
list_items.contact_records: records of your contact with us
list_items.photographs: photographs provided by you or taken at Futures Church services or events
list_items.sensitive_info: We may also collect and store sensitive personal information such as:
list_items.health_pastoral: health information provided during pastoral meetings
list_items.health_attendance: health information to assist attendance at Futures Church services and events
list_items.religious_information: religious information (attendance at services, church events / activities, personal faith decisions, baptism etc)
list_items.recording_notice: It is important to also note that all services (including various other activities) of Futures Church are recorded. Images of the people attending or participating in the service (or other activity) may be used and shown in our services, Resources and for other promotional purposes and commercial activities. By attending any service (or other activity) you agree to Futures Church using your image and personal information in these recordings.

use_information.title: 2. How we use your information
use_information.paragraph1: Futures Church will use the personal information we collect for the purpose disclosed at the time of collection, or otherwise as set out in this Privacy Policy. We will not use your personal information for any other purpose without first seeking your consent, unless authorised or required by law. Generally we will only use and disclose your personal information as follows:

list_items.maintain_involvement: (a) to establish and maintain your involvement with the Church, including providing you with newsletters and information on upcoming events
list_items.provide_services: (b) to provide the products or services you have requested from the Church
list_items.register_events: (d) to register you for events, conferences or promotions
list_items.improve_services: (e) to assist us to make the Church's sites, services and products more valuable to our community
list_items.promotion: (f) for direct promotion of products or services and to keep you informed of new developments we believe may be of interest to you
list_items.third_parties: (g) to third parties where we have retained those third parties to assist us to operate the Church and provide the products or services you have requested, such as religious education instructors, catering and event coordinators, promotions companies, transport providers, health care providers, website hosts and IT consultants, and our professional advisers such as consultants, lawyers and accountants. In some circumstances we may need to disclose sensitive information about you to third parties as part of the services you have requested
list_items.internal_use: (h) to different parts of the Church to enable the development and promotion of other products and services and to improve our general ability to assist Church attendees and the wider community. Information you provide electronically, including through this website, may be held on computers in Futures Churches locations and on servers in Australia. Information you provide in paper form may be transferred to secure virtual systems or stored in secure physical filing systems. We will never share, sell, or rent your personal information with third parties for their promotional use.

access_information.title: 3. Access to your information
access_information.paragraph1: You can make a request to access your personal information that the Church holds about you by contacting the Church’s Privacy Officer as set out below. We will provide you with access to your personal information unless we are legally authorised to refuse your request. We may charge a reasonable amount for providing access.
access_information.paragraph2: If you wish to change personal information that is out of date or inaccurate at any time please contact us. After notice from you, we will take reasonable steps to correct any of your information which is inaccurate, incomplete or out of date. If you wish to have your personal information deleted, please let us know and we will delete that information wherever practicable.
access_information.paragraph3: We may refuse your request to access, amend or delete your personal information in certain circumstances. If we do refuse your request, we will provide you with a reason for our decision and, in the case of amendment, we will note with your personal information that you have disputed its accuracy.

security.title: 4. Security
security.paragraph1: The Church will take reasonable steps to keep secure any personal information which we hold and to keep this information accurate and up to date. Personal information is stored in a secure server or secure files.
security.paragraph2: The Internet is not a secure method of transmitting information. Accordingly, the Church cannot accept responsibility for the security of information you send to or receive from us over the Internet or for any unauthorised access or use of that information.

changes_policy.title: 5. Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes_policy.paragraph1: The Church may amend this Privacy Policy from time to time by having the amended version available at the information counters at the Church or on our website at https://futures.church/australia/
changes_policy.paragraph2: We suggest that you visit our website regularly to keep up to date with any changes.

contact_us.title: 6. Contacting us
contact_us.paragraph1: If you would like any further information, or have any queries, problems or complaints relating to the Church’s Privacy Policy or our information handling practices in general, please contact our Privacy Officer by calling +61 8 8336 0000 or writing to The Privacy Officer, Influencers Church, 57 Darley Road, Paradise SA 5075, AUSTRALIA.

errors.invalidImageType: Only JPEG, PNG, or GIF images are allowed
errors.imageTooLarge: Image size must be less than 5MB

information_collect.paragraph3: To support your experience with Futures Church and meet community needs, we collect personal and sensitive information, including contact details, health-related information, and religious preferences.

information_usage.title: How We Use Your Information
information_usage.bullet1: Facilitate event registrations and service attendance.
information_usage.bullet2: Provide updates on church events, programs, and services.
information_usage.bullet3: Improve our operations, safety, and community engagement.
information_usage.conclusion: We do not collect personal data without your knowledge, and we only use the information for purposes directly related to your interaction with Futures Church. No personal data is sold or shared for marketing purposes.

analytics.dashboard_prompt: Click on a dashboard tile to view detailed analytics

feedback.heading: Feedback
feedback.subheading: We value your feedback! Please help us improve our services.
feedback.footer: Your feedback is important to us and helps improve our translation services for everyone. All responses are confidential and will be used solely for service improvement purposes.
